alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 11:28PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Humboldt and western Elko Counties through 1215 AM PDT... At 1128 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Paradise Valley to 19 miles northeast of Golconda. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paradise Valley, Chimney Dam Reservoir, Adam Peak, and Twin Creeks Mine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
